intro: Seymeria tenuisecta, commonly known as the slender leaf seymeria, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Seymeria tenuisecta is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
